page.title: 01BATLEY
page.content: Batley is a town in the county of West Yorkshire and has a population of about 45,000.The town centre is in the bottom of a valley along which runs the main road linking Dewsbury and Bradford.Most of the commercial and industrial buildings are on either side of this main road with the main areas of housing being on the valley sides. Most of the industrial buildings were built during the period from 1850 to 1900,although there have been new shops built in the centre of the town and some new industrial and commercial building. Many of the mills built to produce cloth in the 19th. century are now used to store various kinds of things other than producing cloth.
